page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY - WOODHALL SPA
page.content: {LOCAL HISTORY WOODHALL SPA} Whilst boring for coal in 1811 very rich mineral waters were discovered.In 1834 a bath house was made by Thomas Hotchkin,the then owner of Woodhall and it became known as Woodhall Spa. These waters were used by rheumatism sufferers until 1984 when the bath house's foundations collapsed.The remains of Kirkstead Abbey still stand with its 13th century Chapel of St. Leonards within its vicinity.The River Witham flows through Kirkstead and prior to the construction of the bridge in 1968 the river was crossed by ferry and footbridge.In 1848 a single railway line was built between Boston and Lincoln.The line between Kirkstead and Horncastle was open in 1855.The lines closed in 1971.W.W.11 RAF Squadron 617,The Dambusters,had their mess in the Petwood Hotel.
